sentences.en: an unheralded visit from his aunt
He came and went during these months, arriving unheralded and leaving without saying good - by.
sentences.cn: 在这几个月里,他经常来来去去, 来时不预先通报,去时也不说再见.

sentences.en: In recent weeks, the previously - unheralded Edu has come to prominence with impressive displays and important goals.
sentences.cn: 在前几个星期, 曾经默默无闻的埃度凭给人深刻印象的表现和重要进球赢得了很多关注.

sentences.en: It is a rare success in the war on drugs, and an oddly unheralded one.
sentences.cn: 在打击毒品的战役中,这是个罕见的胜利, 更奇怪的是这胜利来得毫无征兆.

sentences.en: Nature has taught the beasts of the field to fly when some unheralded danger threatens.
sentences.cn: 造物主赋予野外的走兽以本能,一遇到突如其来的危险威胁就逃之夭夭.

sentences.en: The majority of us lead quiet, unheralded lives as we pass through this world.
sentences.cn: 我们大多数人在走过这个世界的时候过着一种平静而默默无闻的生活.

sentences.en: They are inviting talented, but unheralded film-makers to submit examples of their work.
sentences.cn: 他们邀请有才气却尚未幸遇伯乐的电影制作人提交作品样本。

words.tran_cn: 未事先宣布的；没料到的；未被承认的

trans.tran_cn: （艺术家、运动员等）被埋没的，怀才未遇的，出乎意料的；毫无先兆的
trans.tran_en: if an event is unheralded, there is no warning that it is going to happen
